CatDescriptText: Dorothy McCune, unemployed, 7073 Spinn Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "At our home, where there are children aged 16 and 10, my mother rules the house.  Of the families that I know, the parents are the rulers."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy McCune wearing dark coat, and light colored button down sweater with stand up collar, standing in front of wooden door with window sign with picture of barbershop pole inscribed "2149 Get Wildroot Cream-Oil Charlie", and chiseled stone block wall on right
